Perceived_purpose1: The purpose of the Coin flip game was too see whether or not someone would lie about something given the outcome is only known by said person. One person knows about the details and knows whether or not the coin lands on head or tails. The other person doesn't know the coin flip outcome and has to rely on the first person to tell them the truth about it. Since lying benefits the observer of the coin more so then telling the truth, the game is set up to see if the observer will choose to benefit himself or share with the other player. It also sets up the purpose of The Choice Game that comes later.
Perceived_purpose2: The purpose of the Choice Game was to see what decision someone would make after finding out what type of person their partner in the game was and what decision said partner made in a previous game with someone else. The player that is in control of sending the two dollars over has total control in this game. Sending the two dollars to the other player is risky because the other player, after the money grows, can keep all of the money to him/herself or split the money with the other player. However the player sending the money is told about the type of person his partner is via decisions that partner made in a previous task.

Perceived_purpose2: To see if we are positively influenced by a person appearing benevolent in one situation when compared to another.  However, in the first scenario the sender only had a difference of $0.25 between one choice and another. He could afford to be benevolent. In the Choice game it felt more like an all or nothing situation and I did not want to risk it.
